snippet.textDisplay: Your first mistake: buying a 3DS on launch day. Your second: giving it up; because it has turned out to be one of the best handheld gaming devices ever.
snippet.textOriginal: Your first mistake: buying a 3DS on launch day. Your second: giving it up; because it has turned out to be one of the best handheld gaming devices ever.

snippet.textDisplay: I bought a 3DS on launch day, hoping it would bring a different perspective to my mobile gaming.  Unfortunately, in my eyes, it never really did, and I ended up giving it to my nephew for his birthday.  The only game I miss from this system was Pilotwings Resort, and the relaxing feeling it gave me.
snippet.textOriginal: I bought a 3DS on launch day, hoping it would bring a different perspective to my mobile gaming.  Unfortunately, in my eyes, it never really did, and I ended up giving it to my nephew for his birthday.  The only game I miss from this system was Pilotwings Resort, and the relaxing feeling it gave me.

snippet.textDisplay:
@christbl58 I don't think I mentioned the games at all. Pilotwings is actually great. I was talking about how for the first time, they are relying on the current not too successful 3d boon to sell a product that didn't need it in the first place. Please don't miss-quote.
I will be sticking with my much loved and still daily played (since it was released) DS Lite thanks. Great music though op, sorry about thus mild diversion from it. :)

@christbl58 I don't think I mentioned the games at all. Pilotwings is actually great. I was talking about how for the first time, they are relying on the current not too successful 3d boon to sell a product that didn't need it in the first place. Please don't miss-quote.
I will be sticking with my much loved and still daily played (since it was released) DS Lite thanks. Great music though op, sorry about thus mild diversion from it. :)

snippet.textDisplay: @Masz52 To me real vgm truly sets the mood and atmosphere of a particular environment and whenever you think of or see that environment or hear the music you immediately think of the other. In other words, the music and the environment it was put to are inseparably linked in your memory because the music brought its environment to life.
snippet.textOriginal: @Masz52 To me real vgm truly sets the mood and atmosphere of a particular environment and whenever you think of or see that environment or hear the music you immediately think of the other. In other words, the music and the environment it was put to are inseparably linked in your memory because the music brought its environment to life.

snippet.textDisplay: @Masz52 I think he's referring to the kind of music people were spoiled by in the late 80s/early-mid 90s where music was more memorable than a lot of music people tend to compare to today. I would tend to disagree; I feel that video game music has only evolved further from a limited palette of 3 tones at a time to sweeping orchestral pieces like in Beyond Good & Evil.
snippet.textOriginal: @Masz52 I think he's referring to the kind of music people were spoiled by in the late 80s/early-mid 90s where music was more memorable than a lot of music people tend to compare to today. I would tend to disagree; I feel that video game music has only evolved further from a limited palette of 3 tones at a time to sweeping orchestral pieces like in Beyond Good & Evil.

snippet.textDisplay: If I ever get a 3DS, this is one of the games I want. The SNES and N64 games were both challenging, but really fun to play on a relaxing afternoon. This song has the same old style the others had. It SOUNDS perfect for soaring through the air.
